docs.title: Lightroom AI Tagger Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for Lightroom AI Tagger, an intelligent tagging assistant for Adobe Lightroom Classic that leverages OpenAI's CLIP model to automatically generate relevant keywords for your photos.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Lightroom AI Tagger helps photographers streamline their workflow by:

  • Automatically analyzing images using advanced AI
  • Generating relevant keywords based on image content
  • Updating XMP sidecar files while preserving existing keywords
  • Supporting RAW and JPEG formats
  • Using industry-standard keyword hierarchies

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Install the package: 

    pip install lr-autotag

  2. Run the tagger: 

    lr-autotag --catalog "path/to/catalog.lrcat"

Or for a folder of images: 

lr-autotag --image-folder "path/to/images"

docs.title: Safety Features
docs.text:
• Automatic catalog backups
  • Non-destructive keyword updates
  • Dry-run mode for testing

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Read the Installation Guide for detailed setup instructions
  • Check the Basic Usage guide to get started

docs.title: Command Line Interface
docs.text: The lr-autotag command line interface provides several options for controlling the tagging process.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
lr-autotag --catalog "path/to/catalog.lrcat"
# or
lr-autotag --image-folder "path/to/images"

docs.title: Available Options
docs.text: Option Short Description Default --catalog -c Path to Lightroom catalog file None --image-folder -i Path to folder containing images None --output -o Output JSON file for keyword suggestions keyword_suggestions.json --threshold -t Confidence threshold for keywords 0.5 --max-keywords -m Maximum keywords per image 20 --overwrite Overwrite existing keywords False --dry-run Don't modify XMP files False --keywords-file Path to custom keywords file Foundation List 2.0.1.txt

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Process a Lightroom catalog with custom settings: 

lr-autotag --catalog "photos.lrcat" --threshold 0.3 --max-keywords 30

Process a folder of images in dry-run mode: 

lr-autotag --image-folder "vacation_photos" --dry-run --output "keywords.json"

Use a custom keywords list: 

lr-autotag --catalog "photos.lrcat" --keywords-file "my_keywords.txt"

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 Success 1 Invalid arguments or configuration 2 Processing error

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
• CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES: Control GPU usage
  • LR_AUTOTAG_DEBUG: Enable debug logging when set to "1"

docs.title: Configuration Guide
docs.text: Learn how to configure Lightroom AI Tagger for optimal performance and results.

docs.title: Command Line Options
docs.text:
These settings can be configured per run:

Option Description Default Example threshold Minimum confidence score 0.5 --threshold 0.3 max-keywords Keywords per image 20 --max-keywords 30 keywords-file Custom keywords list Foundation List 2.0.1.txt --keywords-file custom.txt

docs.title: Keywords File Format
docs.text:
The keywords file should follow this format:

[Category Name]
keyword1
keyword2 {alias1, alias2}
  subcategory1
  subcategory2 {alt1, alt2}

Example: 

[Nature]
landscape
mountain {mountains, mountainous}
  alpine
  rocky {rocks, rocky terrain}

docs.title: GPU Acceleration
docs.text:
Enable GPU support by: 1. Installing CUDA drivers 2. Setting environment variables: 

export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0

docs.title: Memory Usage
docs.text: Control memory usage with: - Batch size adjustments - Image size limits - Process count settings

docs.title: Low Accuracy Mode
docs.text:
lr-autotag --catalog "photos.lrcat" \
    --threshold 0.25 \
    --max-keywords 30

docs.title: Fast Processing Mode
docs.text:
lr-autotag --catalog "photos.lrcat" \
    --threshold 0.5 \
    --max-keywords 15

docs.title: Custom Keywords Mode
docs.text:
lr-autotag --catalog "photos.lrcat" \
    --keywords-file "custom_keywords.txt" \
    --threshold 0.4

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • Adobe Lightroom Classic
  • 4GB+ RAM recommended
  • CUDA-capable GPU (optional, for faster processing)

docs.title: Using pip (Recommended)
docs.text: pip install lr-autotag

docs.title: Development Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/jsakkos/lr-autotag.git
cd lr-autotag

  2. Create and activate virtual environment: 

    python -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate

  3. Install dependencies: 

    pip install -e ".[dev]"

docs.title: Verifying Installation
docs.text:
Test your installation:

lr-autotag --help

You should see the following output:

Usage: lr-autotag [OPTIONS]

  AI-powered keyword tagging for Adobe Lightroom Classic

Options:
  --catalog TEXT         Path to Lightroom catalog
  --image-folder TEXT    Path to folder containing images
  --output TEXT         Output JSON file  [default: keyword_suggestions.json]
  --threshold FLOAT     Confidence threshold for keywords  [default: 0.5]
  --max-keywords INTEGER  Maximum keywords per image  [default: 20]
  --overwrite          Overwrite existing keywords
  --dry-run           Don't modify XMP files, only save suggestions
  --keywords-file TEXT  Path to the keywords file
  --help              Show this message and exit.
